name: Emperor
short_description: Supreme ruler of an empire, highest rank among monarchs

name: Empress
short_description: Female emperor or wife of an emperor, supreme female ruler

name: King
short_description: Male monarch ruling a kingdom, sovereign head of state

name: Queen
short_description: Female monarch or wife of a king, royal sovereign

name: High King
short_description: King ruling over other kings, supreme royal authority

name: High Queen
short_description: Female equivalent of High King, supreme queen

name: Prince
short_description: Son of a monarch or nobleman of high rank

name: Princess
short_description: Daughter of a monarch or noblewoman of high rank

name: Archduke
short_description: High-ranking nobleman, typically ruling an archduchy

name: Archduchess
short_description: Female archduke or wife of an archduke

name: Grand Duke
short_description: Sovereign duke ranking above ordinary dukes

name: Grand Duchess
short_description: Female grand duke or wife of a grand duke

name: Duke
short_description: High-ranking nobleman ruling a duchy under the monarch

name: Duchess
short_description: Female duke or wife of a duke

name: Marquis
short_description: Nobleman ranking above count, often governing border territories

name: Marchioness
short_description: Female marquis or wife of a marquis

name: Count
short_description: Nobleman governing a county, ranking below marquis

name: Countess
short_description: Female count or wife of a count

name: Earl
short_description: English nobleman equivalent to count, governing a shire

name: Viscount
short_description: Nobleman ranking below count but above baron

name: Viscountess
short_description: Female viscount or wife of a viscount

name: Baron
short_description: Lowest rank of nobility, holding land directly from the crown

name: Baroness
short_description: Female baron or wife of a baron

name: Baronet
short_description: Hereditary title below baron but above knight

name: Knight
short_description: Warrior granted title for military service, lowest noble rank

name: Dame
short_description: Female equivalent of knight, honorary title for women

name: Lord
short_description: General noble title, master of lands or holding authority

name: Lady
short_description: Female lord or wife of a lord, noblewoman

name: Esquire
short_description: Landed gentry above gentleman but below knight

name: Gentleman
short_description: Man of good social position, lowest rank of gentry

name: Page
short_description: Young noble serving in a household, first step to knighthood

name: Regent
short_description: Person ruling on behalf of monarch who is minor or absent

name: Heir Apparent
short_description: Person next in line to inherit a throne or title

name: Consort
short_description: Spouse of a reigning monarch, queen or king consort

name: Pope
short_description: Head of the Catholic Church, Bishop of Rome

name: Cardinal
short_description: High-ranking Catholic official, advisor to the Pope

name: Bishop
short_description: Senior Christian cleric overseeing a diocese

name: Abbot

name: Abbess
short_description: Female head of a nunnery, leader of nuns

name: Prior

name: Prioress

name: Archdeacon

name: Dean
short_description: Senior cleric in charge of a cathedral or college

name: Canon
short_description: Member of cathedral clergy, follows canonical rules

name: Priest
short_description: Ordained cleric authorized to perform religious ceremonies

name: Chaplain
short_description: Cleric serving a specific institution or noble household

name: Friar
short_description: Traveling preacher belonging to mendicant religious order

name: Monk
short_description: Man living in religious community under monastic vows

name: Novice

name: Missionary
